00022 #ifndef _EEPROM_H
00023 #define _EEPROM_H
00024 
00025 // \cond
00026 /******************************************************************************
00027                    Includes section
00028 ******************************************************************************/
00029 #include <types.h>
00030 
00031 /******************************************************************************
00032                    Define(s) section
00033 ******************************************************************************/
00034 #if defined(AT91SAM7X256)
00035   #define EEPROM_DATA_MEMORY_SIZE 0x400u
00036 #elif defined(ATMEGA1281) || defined(ATMEGA2561) || defined(ATMEGA1284) || defined(AT90USB1287) \
00037    || defined(ATXMEGA256A3) || defined(ATXMEGA256D3) || defined(ATMEGA128RFA1) \
00038    || defined(AT91SAM3S4C)
00039   #define EEPROM_DATA_MEMORY_SIZE 0x1000u
00040 #elif defined(ATXMEGA128A1)
00041   #define EEPROM_DATA_MEMORY_SIZE 0x800u
00042 #endif
00043 // \endcond
00044 
00045 /******************************************************************************
00046                    Types section
00047 ******************************************************************************/
00048 /**************************************************************************/
00051 typedef struct
00052 {
00054   uint16_t address;
00056   uint8_t *data;
00058   uint16_t length;
00059 } HAL_EepromParams_t;
00060 
00061 /******************************************************************************
00062                    Prototypes section
00063 ******************************************************************************/
00064 /******************************************************************************
00065 \brief Reads a number of bytes defined by HAL_EepromParams_t from the EEPROM.
00066 \param[in]
00067   param - address of HAL_EepromParams_t structure. \n
00068   fields of structure set by user: \n
00069   address - eeprom address \n
00070   data - pointer to data memory \n
00071   length - number of bytes
00072 \param[in]
00073   readDone - pointer to the function that will notify about reading completion.
00074 \return
00075   0 - success, \n
00076   -1 - the number of bytes to write is too large, \n
00077   -2 - the previous EEPROM request is not completed yet.
00078 ******************************************************************************/
00079 int HAL_ReadEeprom(HAL_EepromParams_t *params, void (*readDone)());
00080 
00081 /******************************************************************************
00082 \brief Writes a number of bytes defined by HAL_EepromParams_t to EEPROM.
00083 By writeDone parameter user can control if write operation will be asynchronous
00084 or synchronous.
00085 \param[in]
00086   param - address of HAL_EepromParams_t structure. \n
00087   fields of structure set by user: \n
00088   address - eeprom address \n
00089   data - pointer to data memory \n
00090   length - number of bytes
00091 \param[in]
00092   writeDone - pointer to the function that will notify about reading completion. \n
00093   Only for avr: \n
00094   if writeDone is NULL write operation will be synchronous.
00095 \return
00096   0 - success, \n
00097   -1 - the number of bytes to write is too large, \n
00098   -2 - the previous EEPROM request is not completed yet.
00099 ******************************************************************************/
00100 int HAL_WriteEeprom(HAL_EepromParams_t *params, void (*writeDone)());
00101 
00102 /**************************************************************************/
00109 bool HAL_IsEepromBusy(void);
00110 
00111 #endif /*_EEPROM_H*/
